metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from the Zhangye wetland station eddy covariance system (EC) in the midstream reaches of the Heihe integrated observatory network from January 1 to December 31 in 2023. The site (100.44640° E, 38.97514° N) was located in the Zhangye City in Gansu Province. The elevation is 1460 m. The EC was installed at a height of 5.2 m, and the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (Gill&Li7500A) was 0.25 m.
The raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Eddypro post-processing software, including the spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. The observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC): class 1-3 (high quality), class 4-6 (good), class 7-8 (poor, better than gap filling data), class9 (rejected). In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened in a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data collected before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 3% of the 30 min raw record. There were 48 records per day, and the missing data were replaced with -6999. Suspicious data were marked in red. 
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (z/L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xls format. Detailed information can be found in the suggested references.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information) and Liu et al. (2023).

该数据集包含了2023年1月1日至2023年12月31日的黑河水文气象观测网中游张掖湿地站涡动相关仪观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市，下垫面是湿地。观测点的经纬度是100.44640E, 38.97514N，海拔1460.00m。涡动相关仪的架高5.2m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速温度仪（Gill）与CO2/H2O分析仪(Li7500A)之间的距离是25cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Eddypro软件处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Eddypro软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据中每30min内缺失率大于10%的数据。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），奥布霍夫长度L（m），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为九级（质量标识1-3数据质量好，4-6数据质量较好，7-8数据质量较差（较插补数据好）；9数据质量差））。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型包含所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，当EC通量测量的潜热（LE）和感热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完整时，这一任务变得更加困难。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这一温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层组件温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观测比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估计蒸散发（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡动相关（EC）测量，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性增加，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔上25米高的平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用了地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮度温度。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠地区已被前期研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），阿拉尔海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集，这些数据集包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时还包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据存档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the challenges of estimating evapotranspiration using the TSEB model differ from the challenges in measuring energy and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用TSEB模型估算蒸散发的挑战与在绿洲-沙漠地区测量能量和碳交换的挑战有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The TSEB model faces challenges primarily in estimating surface fluxes due to uncertainties like surface–air temperature differences and the strong advective environment, particularly in irrigated areas. On the other hand, measuring energy and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas involves challenges related to ecological degradation, such as drying rivers and desertification. Both approaches must tackle environmental and model-specific uncertainties, but they differ in focus: TSEB on temperature and model accuracy, and oasis–desert systems on ecological balance and data collection stability.
Comparison.AnswerCn: TSEB模型在估计表面通量方面面临挑战，主要是由于表面与空气温度差异和强烈的平流环境的不确定性，特别是在灌溉区。另一方面，在绿洲-沙漠地区测量能量和碳交换则面临与生态退化相关的挑战，例如河流干涸和沙漠化。这两种方法都必须应对环境和模型特定的不确定性，但它们的重点不同：TSEB关注温度和模型准确性，而绿洲-沙漠系统则关注生态平衡和数据收集的稳定性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways do long-term observations of hydrometeorological and flux data enhance the understanding of oasis–desert interactions and support sustainable development?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 长期观测水文气象和通量数据如何增强对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的理解，并支持可持续发展？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Long-term observations provide comprehensive datasets that capture seasonal and interannual variability in energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes. These datasets are essential for understanding the interactions between oasis and desert systems, which is critical for maintaining ecological balance and supporting sustainable development through informed management and policy-making.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 长期观测提供了全面的数据集，捕捉了能量、水蒸气和碳通量的季节性和年际变异。这些数据集对于理解绿洲和沙漠系统之间的相互作用至关重要，这对维持生态平衡和通过知情管理与政策制定支持可持续发展具有重要意义。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in effectively measuring evapotranspiration in arid and semi-arid regions using ground-based methods?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，使用地面方法有效测量蒸散发面临的挑战因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: In arid and semi-arid regions, challenges in measuring evapotranspiration arise due to the heterogeneous landscape that includes a mix of soil and vegetation with different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange, making it difficult for one-source models to accurately estimate surface evapotranspiration. Furthermore, errors in derived component temperatures are primarily caused by image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance, and the strong advective environment in these regions adds to the difficulty.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，由于地形的异质性，包括不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合，使得测量蒸散发面临挑战，这使得单源模型难以准确估计表面蒸散发。此外，衍生组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化，而这些地区强烈的平流环境进一步增加了难度。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is the balance between oasis and desert systems important for sustainable oasis development in arid and semi-arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于干旱和半干旱地区可持续绿洲发展的重要性是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The balance between oasis and desert systems is important for sustainable oasis development because these systems play a critical role in maintaining ecological stability and agricultural productivity. Understanding the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in these ecosystems is essential to achieving carbon peaking and carbon neutrality, which supports the ecological security and sustainable development of oases. The interaction between these systems influences the overall environmental health and socioeconomic stability in arid and semi-arid regions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对可持续的绿洲发展至关重要，因为这些系统在维持生态稳定性和农业生产力方面发挥着关键作用。理解这些生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换对于实现碳达峰和碳中和至关重要，这支持了绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展。这些系统之间的相互作用影响着干旱和半干旱地区的整体环境健康和社会经济稳定。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to maintain long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，维持对能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期观测是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are critical to understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems. This understanding is essential to achieving the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality, supporting ecological security, and ensuring the sustainable development of oases. Additionally, these observations help recognize oasis–desert interactions, which are significant for protecting the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 长期观测对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征至关重要。这种理解对于实现碳达峰和碳中和的目标、支持生态安全以及确保绿洲的可持续发展是必不可少的。此外，这些观测有助于识别绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用，这对于保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the intended outcomes of using a high-resolution thermal camera to estimate evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration in agricultural areas?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪估计农业地区的蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散的预期结果是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The use of a high-resolution thermal camera aims to improve the estimation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration by providing accurate soil and canopy component temperatures. These measurements are validated with observed ratios using stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, offering a better understanding of the energy balance in agricultural areas. Achieving reliable estimates in these areas is particularly challenging due to strong advective conditions, and accurate component temperature calculations are crucial for separating evaporation and transpiration effectively.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 高分辨率热像仪的使用旨在通过提供准确的土壤和树冠组件温度来改善蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散的估算。这些测量通过稳定氧和氢同位素的观测比率进行验证，从而更好地理解农业地区的能量平衡。在这些地区获得可靠的估算尤其具有挑战性，因为强烈的平流条件，准确的组件温度计算对于有效区分蒸发和蒸腾至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are involved in processing and quality control of data from eddy covariance systems in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，涡度协方差系统的数据处理和质量控制涉及哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The processing and quality control procedure for eddy covariance system data includes data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing. This involves acquiring half-hourly turbulent flux data, hydrometeorological data, and supplementary vegetation and soil parameters from automatic weather stations, as well as quality control measures to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统数据的处理和质量控制程序包括数据收集、数据处理以及数据归档和共享。这涉及从自动气象站获取半小时的湍流通量数据、气象水文数据以及补充的植被和土壤参数，同时采取质量控制措施以确保数据的准确性和可靠性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the methods used to ensure the accuracy of eddy covariance measurements in highly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高度对流的灌溉农业区域，确保涡度协方差测量准确性的方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To ensure the accuracy of eddy covariance measurements, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures are used alongside the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique for validation. Errors are minimized by addressing image classification errors and uncertainties in radiation transmittances. The TSEB model's performance is evaluated by comparing component temperatures with observed composite radiometric temperatures, ensuring robust estimates of energy and water vapor exchanges.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了确保涡度协方差测量的准确性，地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度与稳定的氧和氢同位素技术一起用于验证。通过解决图像分类错误和辐射透过率的不确定性来最小化误差。通过将组分温度与观测到的复合辐射温度进行比较，评估TSEB模型的性能，从而确保能量和水汽交换的稳健估计。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How does the use of Eddypro software enable the processing and quality control of eddy covariance data for hydrometeorological studies in wetland environments?
Enablement.QuestionCn: Eddypro软件如何在湿地环境的水文气象研究中实现涡度协方差数据的处理和质量控制。
Enablement.AnswerEn: Eddypro software processes the raw 10Hz data into 30-minute flux values, applying steps such as spurious point removal, time delay correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, ultrasonic virtual temperature correction, and density correction. It also evaluates the quality of flux values based on atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity tests, ensuring robust data collection in wetland environments.
Enablement.AnswerCn: Eddypro软件将原始的10Hz数据处理为30分钟的通量值，应用了诸如异常点去除、时间延迟校正、坐标旋转、频率响应校正、超声虚拟温度校正和密度校正等步骤。它还根据大气稳定性和湍流相似性测试评估通量值的质量，确保在湿地环境中进行稳健的数据收集。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions and technologies enable the long-term monitoring of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件和技术能够实现对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期监测？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The establishment of a network of land surface flux and meteorological stations, including superstations and ordinary stations, equipped with eddy covariance systems and scintillometers, enable monitoring. These systems, combined with automatic weather stations and supplementary vegetation and soil parameter data, facilitate long-term observations in oasis-desert ecosystems.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 建立一个包括超级站和普通站的地表通量和气象站网络，配备涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪，能够进行监测。这些系统结合自动气象站和补充的植被及土壤参数数据，促进了在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的长期观测。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might data collection in oasis–desert ecosystems face unique challenges related to energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，数据收集可能面临与能量、水汽和碳交换相关的独特挑战。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Data collection in oasis–desert ecosystems faces challenges due to complex interactions between oasis and desert systems. These areas are critical for maintaining ecological stability and socioeconomic development, yet they are vulnerable to environmental degradation, such as river and lake drying, vegetation degradation, desertification, and dust storms. Long-term observations are essential to quantitatively understand these exchanges and support sustainable development.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，数据收集面临挑战，因为绿洲和沙漠系统之间存在复杂的相互作用。这些地区对维持生态稳定和社会经济发展至关重要，但它们也容易受到环境退化的影响，例如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化、沙漠化和沙尘暴。长期观察对于定量理解这些交换过程并支持可持续发展至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the reasons behind using a high-resolution thermal camera for measuring soil and canopy component temperatures in the field of terrestrial water cycle research?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在陆地水循环研究中，使用高分辨率热像仪测量土壤和冠层成分温度的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: A high-resolution thermal camera is used to measure soil and canopy component temperatures because it provides precise inputs for models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model. This method overcomes limitations of existing composite temperature separation approaches, especially in arid regions, and allows for better validation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration estimates. Accurate component temperature measurement helps in separating latent fluxes of soil and vegetation components, which is crucial for model improvements and reliable estimations.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 高分辨率热像仪用于测量土壤和冠层成分的温度，因为它为像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型提供了精确的输入。这种方法克服了现有复合温度分离方法的局限性，特别是在干旱地区，并允许更好地验证蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发的估算。准确的成分温度测量有助于分离土壤和植被成分的潜热通量，这对模型改进和可靠估算至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is the eddy covariance (EC) system commonly employed in studies of evapotranspiration and energy fluxes over heterogeneous land surfaces?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差（EC）系统为何在异质土地表面的蒸散发和能量通量研究中被广泛采用？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The eddy covariance (EC) system is employed because it provides direct measurements of turbulent fluxes, including latent and sensible heat fluxes, which are vital for estimating evapotranspiration (ET) and energy balance in heterogeneous landscapes. Despite challenges like energy balance closure and uncertainties in strongly advective environments, the EC system remains a standard method for validating models like the TSEB model, especially when combined with additional techniques such as stable isotope observations.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差（EC）系统被采用，因为它提供了湍流通量的直接测量，包括潜热和显热通量，这对于估算异质景观中的蒸散发（ET）和能量平衡至关重要。尽管在能量平衡闭合和强对流环境中的不确定性等挑战下，EC系统仍然是验证像TSEB模型这样的模型的标准方法，特别是当与稳定同位素观测等其他技术结合使用时。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What potential advancements in data collection methods could improve the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange processes in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，哪些潜在的数据收集方法的进步可以改善对能量、水蒸气和碳交换过程的理解？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Advancements in data collection methods that could improve understanding of these processes include the development of high-resolution thermal imaging for capturing soil and canopy temperatures, improvements in satellite remote sensing for large-scale observations, and the integration of stable isotope techniques for better validation of evaporation and transpiration estimates. These methods can offer more detailed and accurate datasets, facilitating a deeper understanding of the ecosystem dynamics.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法的进展可以改善对这些过程的理解，包括高分辨率热成像技术的发展，用于捕捉土壤和树冠温度，卫星遥感技术的改进以进行大规模观测，以及稳定同位素技术的整合，以更好地验证蒸发和蒸腾的估算。这些方法可以提供更详细和准确的数据集，促进对生态系统动态的更深入理解。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection methods can handle the uncertainties in measuring soil and vegetation component temperatures in arid regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集方法如何处理干旱地区土壤和植被成分温度测量中的不确定性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data collection methods in arid regions face challenges such as image classification errors, particularly when vegetation abundance affects the accuracy of component temperature measurements. These uncertainties can be caused by soil pixels being misclassified as vegetation pixels, leading to overestimations of canopy temperatures. Additionally, atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance can introduce uncertainties in temperature estimates.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区的数据收集方法面临挑战，例如图像分类错误，特别是当植被丰度影响成分温度测量的准确性时。这些不确定性可能是由于土壤像素被错误分类为植被像素，导致对冠层温度的高估。此外，大气向上辐射和透射率也可能引入温度估计的不确定性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how data from eddy covariance systems can be processed to ensure quality and accuracy in such diverse environmental conditions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解如何在如此多样的环境条件下处理涡度协方差系统的数据，以确保质量和准确性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data from eddy covariance systems undergo processing steps including data collection, processing, and quality control to ensure accuracy. These systems provide half-hourly turbulent flux data, which are cross-referenced with hydrometeorological data and other auxiliary datasets to validate and refine the measurements, ensuring reliability across diverse environmental conditions.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统的数据经过数据收集、处理和质量控制等处理步骤，以确保准确性。这些系统提供半小时的湍流通量数据，并与水文气象数据和其他辅助数据集进行交叉验证，以验证和完善测量结果，确保在不同环境条件下的可靠性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential strategies or methodologies to improve the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimates using two-source energy balance models in heterogeneous landscapes.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 探索在异质景观中使用双源能量平衡模型提高蒸散发估算准确性的潜在策略或方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: To improve accuracy, the TSEB model can utilize ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures. The model performance is affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference, which can be mitigated by accurate component temperature calculation using a high-resolution thermal camera and classifying soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 为了提高准确性，TSEB模型可以利用地面测量的土壤和冠层组件温度。模型性能受到表面与空气温度差异的不确定性影响，这可以通过使用高分辨率热像仪准确计算组件温度，并使用最大似然法对土壤和冠层像素进行分类来减轻。
